alert.note: Alert for Central Horry; Coastal Georgetown; Dillon; Florence; Inland Georgetown; Marion; Northern Horry; Williamsburg (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wilmington (Northeastern South Carolina and Southeastern North Carolina - Wilmington)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 19 at 2:03PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of eastern Florence, Georgetown, southwestern Dillon, southwestern Horry, Marion and central Williamsburg Counties through 300 PM EDT... At 202 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Hyman to near Nesmith to near Jamestown. Movement was east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Georgetown, Marion, Socastee, Andrews, Johnsonville, Latta, Pamplico, Hemingway, Sellers, North Santee, Rhems, Blue Brick, Pee Dee Crossroads, Oatland, Poston, Nesmith, Brittons Neck, Indiantown, Rains and Bucksport. This includes Interstate 95 in South Carolina near mile marker 186. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Conditions are favorable for the development of weak, brief funnel clouds. Theis type of funnel cloud is harmless, but on rare occasions they can briefly touch down, producing wind gusts over 50 mph. If a funnel cloud is spotted move indoors and report your sighting to the National Weather Service. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Central Horry; Coastal Georgetown; Dillon; Florence; Inland Georgetown; Marion; Northern Horry; Williamsburg
